intro: Eugenia subterminalis, commonly known as the pink guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, pinkish fruits that are edible. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are white and fragrant. The fruit is often used in local cuisines and has a sweet, aromatic flavor.
